headings: You rely on Al Jazeera for truth and transparency
India, Pakistan trade gunfire as tensions rise over deadly Kashmir attack
Kashmir attack: Why India’s Indus Waters Treaty freeze threatens Pakistan
Pakistan suspends trade and closes border with India over Kashmir tensions
Kashmir updates: Pakistan claims Pahalgam attack ‘false flag operation’
Video: India vows ‘loud & clear’ response to Kashmir attack
Photos: Manhunt under way in Kashmir after deadly attack on tourists
What is The Resistance Front, the group claiming the deadly Kashmir attack?
Updates: India shuts border with Pakistan after Pahalgam attack in Kashmir
‘Act of war’: What happened in Kashmir attack that killed 26 tourists?
Video: Tourists killed in Indian-administered Kashmir attack
Attack on tourists kills 26 in Indian-administered Kashmir: Police
Photos: Trump’s tariffs threaten Kashmir’s carpet-weaving legacy
Kashmir’s famed saffron faces devastating new terror: Porcupines
Wave of Kashmir disappearances, mystery deaths spook tribal community
paragraphs: Pakistan promises to defend sovereignty as India’s Modi pledges to hunt Pahalgam gunmen ‘to the ends of the Earth’.
Pakistan has deemed India’s suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty following tourist attack in Pahalgam an ‘act of war’.
Pakistan has suspended all trade with India and closed its airspace and land border.
Pakistan’s defence minister says the government suspects ‘very strongly that it was a ‘false flag operation’.
Relatives of victims of the Kashmir attack held funerals for their loved ones as India vowed its response to the attack.
The attack in Indian-administered Kashmir came amid the peak tourist season and prompted global condemnation.
Founded in 2019, the little-known group has now taken centre stage in the conflict between India and the rebels.
Security forces carry out a major manhunt in disputed region, a day after gunmen opened fire on tourists, killing 26.
The deadliest attack on tourists in Kashmir since 2000 has prompted fears of Indian retaliation against Pakistan.
A group of gunmen have killed at least 28 tourists visiting Pahalgam in Indian-administered Kashmir.
Little-known group Kashmir Resistance claims responsibility for the attack in resort town of Pahalgam.
The 28-percent US tariff means the imported carpets will become significantly more expensive for American consumers.
Kashmir’s saffron farmers are losing 30 percent of their crop to the rodents as deforestation pushes them into farms.
Young men disappear, their dead bodies found weeks later in canals. Kashmir’s Gujjars refuse to believe they drowned.
